catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 55
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: album with six colorful paintings with poems; image of blossoming tree with river; blossoming trees with hikers amid hills; blooming flowers; flowers amid thatched rooves; grasses blowing in wind with geese; autumn red maple leaves; images extend borders
inscription:
Inscriptions

Two poems translated in catalogue: (Mountain cherries fall / from the sky at dawn, / like a snowstorm / over the unknown mountains) by Fujiwara Teika from Shui guso; (Ah, how many drops of dew / will spill / from leaves of grass-- / fall winds are rising / on Miyagino plain.) by Priest Saigyo
title: Poems from Shūi gusō and Shin kokin wakashū, Six Immortal Poets from the Shinkokinshu
